author: Source: Network World
title: Government watchdog blasts IRS for mismanaged migrations from Windows XP, Ser... - Network World
text:
Government auditors have blasted the Internal Revenue Service for missing deadlines to upgrade Windows XP PCs and data center servers running Windows Server 2003, both of which have been retired by Microsoft . In a recently released report, the Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration criticized the IRS for spending nearly $140 million on upgrading Windows XP to Windows 7 even as it failed to meet the support cut-off of April 2014.
Start the conversation, or Read more at Network World.
